149821780.review: I had to refund. The janky art style, the comic at the beginning intro especially, not my cup of tea. the game-play was the part i really did not enjoy, if the ui made more sense and there was a tutorial, maybe it would help, but the right side of the screen shows you can only have 5-6 items equipped at a time, it doesn't say you will loose the previous one if you buy another one for the same slot. It randomly gives you a combo item if they synergize together, but still take up the same amount of slots so you can only get three combo items max. the enemy hit boxes and movement are janky, the music is blaring and the sound effects are whisper quite, so I tuned the music way down but that barely helped. all in all the more I played it the more I saw no effort and no fun to be had, holo cure (free) is way better than this, vampire survivors, halls of torment, scarlet tower, brotatoe, bone raiser minions, bio prototype, and nordic ashes. I could list 20 more better versions of this game you should buy, and avoid this one.

143743558.review:
I got this in a bundle with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/tablis/recommended/1498040]Bio-Prototype[/url], otherwise I probably wouldn't have noticed it. And the - unfortunate - similarity which comes to mind is that the English translation of both looks fine at first glance, but isn't. Here it's even more pronounced, because on one hand you have some really nice puns in the flavour text of items, on the other some mechanics/keywords are described downright wrong (misleading). Speaking of puns, there is an amount of poop/fart jokes which might raise an eyebrow, but it fits okay with the overall lighthearted theme.

The game itself is a slow burner... which might be said about most horde survival roguelites with metaprogression, but this feeling is somehow stronger here. If you stick through the first few hours though, hopefully you'll start to discover there is an addictive and decently designed experience to be had here. Achievements are less difficult than what the descriptions sound like and don't require much farming. There is effectively only one kind of map with no features other than trees; on the flip side the amount of weapons to choose from is huge. A solid example of the genre, nothing very special either.

143681650.review:
I'm going to preface this review by stating that I am conflicted on recommending it. However it isn't because it's a bad game it's for the poor translation and English support making it difficult to figure out some of the things you need to do and the fact that the developers uploaded the games soundtrack to youtubes content ID system so most videos that could help you get taken down. 

This is another survivors clone with the twist being that everything is like 2.5d, The weapons and synergies are okay if difficult to maintain and upgrade the ones you want to keep. The characters are all unique and have their own little 2 page comic story. The music isn't terrible and I didn't find myself getting annoyed our muting it in the 22 or so hours it took me to 100% the game. Some replay-ability via endless mode. Lastly the game is done (I believe) It isn't in early access and the developers haven't mentioned future updates (though they did release a post completion content update a few months ago). That may not be important to many but it's nice to be able to say you're done and uninstall a game and not have to reinstall it half a year later because more content was added and now you don't have full completion. In the end despite being conflicted I'm going to recommend this game if you like the survivors / bullet hell style of game play but I also recommend waiting until it's on sale, plenty of other games in the genre will give you more play time for a lower price point. I also don't recommend it if you intended to stream it or upload videos to youtube.

its an okay game but just be forewarned it wont be worth a lot of time.

142274685.review: One of the best Vampire Survivors esque game. The amount of synergies is incredible and the artstyle is positively unique

142235139.review:
Fun game, it doesn't add anything too new or exciting to the genre, but it is none the less a stand out from a pretty saturated market.

What I like
- A good number of viable build options.
- A kooky set of characters.
- Decent level length and difficult ramping.
- Some fun items.

What I dislike
- The meta-game ends rather quickly.
- The number of items will mean you're fishing for the the stuff you want. There is a banish mechanic to assist, though.
- Some of the translations aren't quite spot on, but very minor and nothing impacting game play. 

If you enjoy games of this genre, you'll probably enjoy this.

This game has VERY little content compared to other VS clones.

- the "skill tree" is very boring. It looks big, but actually has almost nothing special and you unlock the whole skill tree in just 4 hours.
- characters hardly differ
- maps are uninspired, few and repetetive
- skills are good, but I don't really like how the game forces you to always replace your skills with other skills to unlock new synergies. I don't want to constantly change my skills every 20 seconds.
- balancing is really bad

141564632.review:
This game is 50/50 to me. This game isn't bad but I'm not recommending it because there are other games of the genre that just do it better, a lot better. As some of the reviews mentioned already, the RNG of this game is REALLY high. The sense of progression is also sorely lacking, it feels more like getting your *** kicked over and over and over again rather than getting somewhere, even if you win. That's not to say that the game is too difficult but more like there are "stat" checks more than anything else. 

Also some abilities feel extremely weak among other things. It also sucks to not really know what combines into what with so many abilities that are already in the game and heaven forbid trying to save up for the most expensive abilities that you get later on. I don't think I've ever been able to afford them without using debt and that's not always a good idea because the RNG rerolls are COMPLETELY random. Now hear me out, you might be saying that they are supposed to be random, but no game is ever truly random. There will be code that is in the background to steer the game closer to giving you what you want to use but oooohhhh boooyyy not in this game. I have had times where I rerolled over 40 times and STILL didn't find the abilities or stats I was looking for which is insane especially when you think about the resource cost for that.

The art style is great, the music is meh, the gameplay isn't that bad, the RNG and difficulty tied to that, ruins the game.

I wont recommend it. Its a roguelike to nerd out the builds, not recommended if you want to play it casually.
It feels like everything is a bit more complicated than necessary, you have a lot of weapons to pick but since each character is good at one mastery and sucks at the other 2, its useless to pick any weapon no from your mastery. Then you have weapon synergies, which add some boost to the attacks but since you need to constantly upgrade and change the weapon, you lose them, and you hessitate between changing the weapon or keeping the synergy, which usually is just a couple % of improvements in some stat, which leads to the other annoying thing which is each weapon attack is influenced by a different stat, so unless you want to nerd out the builds, it will bite you on your back by being underpowered. And the permanent buffs ("talents") you buy after each round are pretty much useless, you cant even grind your way into beating the harder levels.

135283416.review:
It's innovative and fun, but there are some issues that makes it more frustrating to play so I can't recommend it unless these issues are fixed.

1. The RNG is too strong. In order to upgrade, every slot is just a gotcha machine. You spend gold to refresh what you can get... it's not bad if the options are limited. But no, there are too many options, making trying to roll the one you want very difficult.

2. There's no Combo-book like VS or any way to check the combos you discovered. Yes, even if you somehow experimented and found the combos that work, you better memorize them all because the game never tells you anything.

3. Sometimes you keep rerolling the same 10-15 powers instead of all the powers (like 30-40). This makes it very painful because you spent like 100 gold rerolling them only to find the game refuse to give you anything else other than the ones you don't want/need. The Devs  NEED TO look into the RNG mechanism since this is their main mechanic.

4. Either you over-power the mobs, or they over-power you, there is no in-between, especially on higher difficulty.

5. The dmg tick way too fast for our characters. You try to get through a few mobs in front of you to grab the money? There goes your entire shield and half your health! Maybe give us like a 0.1 sec i-frame after getting hit?

Normally for games like this I'd check back and update my comment/recommendation... but for this game I'm not sure if I'll play it again because playing it feels more like gambling than actually playing a game.

134005285.review: One of the more enjoyable Vampire Survivors clones I have checked out.  Compared to the original VS it has much better art, more unique characters, and shorter, more exciting levels.  It also has a variety of interesting weapons and several synergies that can make you exponentially more powerful.  It is somewhat easy, but should have enough content to keep you occupied long enough to justify its price point.

133958223.review:
Pretty cool, it's another one of those mob horde roguelite games you see all over the place and in mobile game ads. The art style's neat, there's tons of attack combos, and the little character story things are pretty cool (despite being in Chinese.)

Issues I've seen so far, very early-access-y:
1. Not much balance in attacks and weapons, some are a million times better than others.
2. Most of the characters are kinda "meh"
3. Most character music is really short, so you get a little 30-second loop of music that plays every single run forever.
4. Bugs, lots of bugs. The most annoying one is that when things get hectic enough, the game just gives up trying to play audio, so you can't tell when you're getting hit, it's just a dull kind of noise that plays instead of audio, kinda sounds like water.
5. The talent tree is just a square, and everything connects to everything else, so there's not much customization on the part of the player, just a "buy everything one by one and max it out" wall.
6. Controller gameplay ignores Steam's built-in deadzone, so unless your controller is made by God himself by hand, you're going to walk around randomly, you're going to jitter, you're going to move right into a boss's face, and the crypto "skills" all become worthless (they require you to stand in place.)

133920796.review:
It's very pretty for a VS-like. The gameplay isn't vastly different from VS, but there is a slight emphasis on RPG-like stats. Each level up offers a randomized selection of stat improvement or temporary bonuses. 
Personally, I didn't find myself minmaxing or organizing complex builds. There are three cooldown reductions: spells, summons, attacks and only one can be lowered to 25% (maximum number). 
This "railroaded" my runs into focusing on attack, summoning or casting skills. But I didn't mind, especially since the characters signal pretty heavily what they're going to rely on through their stat bonuses and unique abilities. 
Unlike VS, skill combinations aren't optional. Every one offers huge bonuses that scale up at higher tiers. Each tier unlocks more skills and skill combinations. There's a lot of choice and it's fun to test new skills and discover strong combinations. 

The skill names and descriptions are "localized" to reference jokes and memes. They didn't bother me, although some might not like it. There also is a lack of sound effects, this is a minor negative that wouldn't matter in every other VS-like, but since NWTL's art and graphic effects are so high quality it stands out a bit.

It's a good-looking, competently made, not-EA VS-like game with a fitting pricetag. Those who like "reverse bullet hells" might enjoy it.

133882602.review:
Love the game, I even made a meme about it and I haven't done that in years. 

It's my forte of Rogue with a Chinese mythology spin to it that I can appreciate. I can't stand Vampire Survivors because it looks ugly to me even though paranormal stuff also fits my genre of likes. I dislike comparing one game with another but for the sake of similarity I ultimately love NWTL way more. 

All of the characters feel different and even the builds feel different when you're using it on another character. They've got their own playstyle that caters to specific builds more or less like Gunfire Reborn just in 2D. I haven't gotten bored of the game yet after 7 hours in and I'm loving all of the characters. 

The ONLY complaint I have is that my game freezes consistently and I have to close it to restart a run, I'm not sure if that's a bug or not considering my craptop is worthy enough to play this effortlessly. 

For $5 with a bunch of replay value? Worth it in my opinion. 

It's going to be one of the games I boot up when I need something light-hearted and a good time. Runs go by fairly quickly(about 10 minutes) and it's a good time on the map getting crotchstamped by about 4,000 teddy bears that want to eat you. 

8/10 until my game stops freezing. Only because I get pissed off and want to play even more.

133654521.review:
this is one of the bad clones, it gets so many things wrong about the vampire survivors formula

1. no addictive pickup animation
2. death animations look like the monster is still alive for 1-2 sec, not satisfying and actually confusing
3. I had a lightning spell but I couldnt even see whether it was proccing or hitting anything. This goes for most spells, it's just so weird. I had a purple upgraded spike thing and it only triggered extremely rarely and didnt even kill the creeps. That for a very expensive upgrade that only triggers every 20sec? It just doesn't make sense. And this for a spell where I put all my points into yin which should boost its damage. The spells are unsatisfying in general, my little cow summon walked up to enemies and did what? I don't know, it was hard to see whether it was even doing damage.
It just doesn't make sense to me.
4. balancing seems very strange in general, the beginning few minutes are alright but quickly you can't kill almost anything anymore. I survived the first round despite there still being a boss around and I didn't even get anything except a bunch of text achievements? I don't get it. Also the first run ends too quickly, weird. I start with nothing in the second run and what exactly did I achieve now? Am I in some kind of campaign because there are other monsters now? No idea.

I don't get how this has so many positive reviews. This is a fairly obviously bad vampire survivors clone.

A very casual and weirdly funny take on the good ol' VS formula with some nice visuals, mediocre music, good skills topped off with awesome syngergies.

But be prepare, right now it's not that many thing to do right now.
There are 4 stages, you defeat the mini bosses to unlock new characters and after you completed most of the talent tree just farm the last stage for secondary character skins. I would say you can easily min-max the game in 12-15 hours if not less.

That's it, but still a fun little game.

Great-first-impression-upvote!

133038493.review: Surprisingly unique, interesting and fun. It is a Bullet Heaven/Survival Roguelike similar to Vampire Survivors in some ways but more complexity behind it. Also has a SHOCKING amount of weapons/skills to experiment with. Can recommend.

133035918.review:
Okay, SOMEONE had a lot of fun translating this game to english. Seriously. It's like I'm reading translation from Deadpool if he had a localization job.

Gameplay-wise, its just standard Survivors gameplay but with a catch: you have unlimited rerolls as long as you have gold. You only have a fixed amount of slots to fill in with abilities, buffs, or random shit that they decided to put in because why not. So, if you're aiming for a build, about 60% of the gameplay is just you praying and rerolling stuff again and again until you can get that exact thing that you wanted. Good luck and may lady luck washes your back.

The artstyle is... simply said: if you take Don't Starve but then made it in China. Yeah. I like it.

Also, the amount of puns/easter eggs/obscure internet memes they have is worth the price of this game.

I am done.

I salute you, random english translator.

133035512.review:
Hi, I am founder of [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/43562394-Impressive-Rogue-Games/] [b]Impressive Rogue Games[/b][/url] which is a specialized curator for rogue and survivorlike games.

I bought today Noobs Want to Live and started testing it.

Here is my feedback which may help you.

1. The talent meta-progression is way to fast. You won't play the game long enough if it goes that fast. A bit more grind would be good
2. The story needs a english translation too
3. I would love to see more meta progressions. Gamers like to have progression through different mechanics. It would be nice, if you could increase this, and add more unique meta progression and not just a talent skill.
4. The music is nice and matching the game
5. All core mechanics like auto aim, controller support, and auto attacks are working fine. 
6.  Otherwise the game is pretty nice and has rare mechanics like forging weapons/skills to new skills. Like in Vampire Survivor.
7. More content would be nice but it has already a decent amount of content.
8. The price is fair and the graphics are super unique.

The rating is genre based and at the moment I would give the game a 8/10.

133021906.review:
A wonderful aesthetic, multiple ways to build your character. It feels so satisfying to play when you get to those late waves and see all the incredible damage coming out from the flexible (flexible as in, you're never locked in to a certain skill) abilities you chose!
I just recently beat difficulty 3 with the summoner and I cannot wait to dive back in and try to beat the higher level!
Highly recommended if you're a fan of Vampire Survivors / similar games. It has lots of achievements to unlock as well!

132962457.review:
[code][h1][b] Nyanco's Reviewヽ(´• ω •`)、[/b][/h1]
[b]+ A Thrilling Roguelike for the Ultimate Build![/b]

[h1][b][1] Intro : [/b][/h1]
Noobs Want to Live is a new and exciting roguelike game that offers players a fast-paced, action-packed experience filled with multiple unique characters and powerful skill synergies. With a large pool of skills to choose from, each run presents a new opportunity to create the ultimate build and fight your way to godhood.

[h1][b][2] Game Experience : [/b][/h1]
One of the standout features of Noobs Want to Live is its cast of multiple unique characters. Whether you prefer the sword master hero, the fireball totting maiden, a mechanically adept summoner, a great yellow canine who literally creates gold, or the master of bacon, there is a character to suit every player's style. Each character has their own unique set of skills, strengths, and weaknesses, making the game a fresh and exciting experience with each playthrough.

The game's graphics add to its overall appeal, with finely crafted cardboard cutout characters giving the game a unique and fun feel. As players progress through the game, they'll encounter monsters and obstacles that will put their skills to the test. They'll need to use their skills to blow up the screen with fireballs and black holes to survive and progress.

One of the game's key mechanics is the ability to master specific skills that create powerful synergies with one another. Peachville is not a town where 1+1 equals 2, it equals at least 4.5. Players will need to figure out which skills synergize well with one another to cause mayhem and destruction to progress through the game. With a large pool of skills to choose from, players will need to experiment with different combinations to find the perfect build for each character.

The game also offers players the ability to reroll their skills for a chance at an even more powerful build. Players can spend gold to reroll their skill selections, with each upgrade potentially taking them from a weak and vulnerable character to a powerful hero. Additionally, players can gain meta-progression in the shape of talent points to make their runs easier as they progress through the game.

[h1][b][3] Verdict : [/b][/h1]
Noobs Want to Live is a game that offers players an exciting and fresh roguelike experience with unique characters and powerful skill synergies. Its fast-paced gameplay and ever-changing builds make each run a new and thrilling adventure. With a mix of strategy, skill, and luck, players will need to fight, kill, and grow to become the ultimate champion.

132889544.review:
[code]Written By Hidden Gems Review : https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38624426/, Follow me! [/code]

Noobs Want to Live is a Bullet hell/Roguelite.

The core of the game is like any vampire survivors, the diference with other games of the same kind it's the artstyle and the variety of skills.

Shooting turds the best and and the funniest, but in general there are a lot of amaizing skills that can be combined, there are so many for choose.. the problem it's there are only 6 slots for unlock skills in a match, I want more ! XD

The artstyle looks like paper pretty interesting which make good visuals.

After all the work made on this game I think it's too low price should be more, so I highly recommend the purchase on this one.

132883981.review:
It's an interesting take on the Survivors-like genre.

The graphics are great, the art direction is fantastic with that comedic "traditional Japanese style" it's going for. The art is really cute and colorful, a contrast to the darker and grimmer works and the retro feel of pixellation, and I enjoy the fun the developers are clearly having with the "story" comics, the names of weapons, and the nature of some of them, like a sheep that poops landmines for your enemies to step on.

Gameplay wise, it's interesting, but a bit of a mess with readability and tutorializing. Instead of gaining new weapons when you level up, you collect a currency, Silver, and then buy upgrades. You aren't stuck with a single upgrade, and can switch to different types of upgrades, depending on RNG, which means that you can use several different types of synergies or switch earlier ones to different upgrades that aren't available in the initial rarity tiers.

The problem is, it's hard to understand without any tutorials. I struggled to figure out I needed to buy upgrades, I wasn't aware that you have to play RNG to upgrade one spell in the same slot, and that there's so much Gold, a second currency, because you might need to reroll, reroll, and reroll, until you get that one upgrade you want to keep a synergy you like.

Still, if it's improved, made more readable and explained better, I see it as an interesting direction to go in the Survivors-like, with the constantly changing arsenal and resource management, with not just having to rely on level ups.

I can't explain it properly, it's not that complex a system, but like I said, difficult to explain for first timers. Anyway, I recommend it, it's an interesting attempt to break into a saturated market with style and new ideas.

132853996.review:
Let's not beat around the bush here, this is a Vampire Survivors clone. If you liked VS, you might be looking at purchasing this differently stylized version of the game.
It's priced in the same area as VS and has many of the same elements that VS has and thus you may feel you'd have a similar experience. Let me break down how I feel about NWTL in its current state.

I've played it a good chunk yesterday and today and I already can see certain things that VS has done right that NWTL hasn't (yet?). Confusion and excitement.

Games like these can be VERY confusing. There's so much flying around on the screen that it's hard to tell whats friendly and what isn't. What you can walk through and what you can't. With VS I thought sometimes things can be confusing and wished it were better but in NWTL it's far, far worse. 
If you play summons for example, anything you summon looks the same as the enemies, your brain can't immediately tell that it won't hurt you if you walk through it. You'll find yourself moving around your own summons and this hurts gameplay.
Things you can and can't walk through are more discernible in this game so you don't need to worry about that as much.
ALERT areas can be confusing if they're also your own. You'll think you can't be in the area or you'll take damage just like the mobs, but this isn't the case. The devs need to work on showing the player what is friendly and what isn't so we can make better judgments while playing.
(Another thing i'll throw in here is that the death animations are too long and you end up not realising you can walk through something "dying" because you still think it's alive. It should either disappear quickly or reduce in transparency to show we can now move through it, may i suggest a very transparent ghost animation?).

Excitement is another big thing here. While I think NWTL has cool sounds and music, something VS had was excitable sounds. When you picked up gems, it felt strong. It felt addictive. In NWTL this isn't the same. I pick up the silvers and golds and while I know I now have more, it feels slow and doesn't feel exciting to go and get them. We all know in VS we've risked it all for a singular gem, in this you don't get that feeling. 
This is something that's difficult to get right, i know, and perhaps VS just got lucky but I do feel like the sounds in this need to be tweaked to be more exciting.

OVERALL though, I still want to play the game. Would I recommend the game? Yes, yes I think i would. There's a lot this game has to offer and can be separated from many of the other VS clones out there and i'm curious to see what else it has in store for me but for now, I do find it slower and more boring than VS and hope that with more playtime, it really ramps up and that they make changes to my suggestions to keep me coming back for more.

The art style is AWESOME.. I love it and clearly the art direction was a high priority from the start, I wouldn't change it one bit!
Give it a go!
